title: Bitcoin - The 3rd time this amazing signal has printed
name: without_worries
contents:
However bearish you might be on future price action. Perhaps you're now selling to buy back in at $12k or below $10k even, consider this:

On the 6-day chart this fact is unbroken:

1) RSI was below 30 and recovers to 30+ (red circles)

AND

2) Falling wedge breakout

= a new all time high being printed.

Granted this has only happened two times before. This will be the 3rd event.

The falling wedge price action breakout should occur around mid-October. A measured move from the breakout takes price action to the $120k area. This is also the approximate area of the Fibonacci 1.618 extension as was in the previous breakouts except for the first at 2.168.

I need your bite, hit the like!

Ww

Comment: Yesterday was the oscillators. Today the overlays. For folks that like moving averages you should see this.

Cyan line 100-week EMA
Yellow line 21-week EMA

The facts of the chart:

Throughout Bitcoin’s price action history the bottom of each bear market was marked by the 21 crossing down the 100.

The bottom was -50% approximately from the cross. Folks calling for $12k need to see that statistic fail to -65%.


Next overlay - log growth curve - the lower supporting curve has never failed.


Still think the bottom is not in?

Comment: “Maybe the wedge breakout needs to backtest past resistance as support before confirming?”

“Nice idea, but price action could still fall another 50%”

Getting a lot of this today.

Two things occur:

1) The majority asking the question do not have a strategy. You will always lose money without one.

2) The majority asking this question do NOT have a strategy. Now I realised I’ve repeated myself but it is such a huge fundamental point I thought it was worth mentioning twice.

Please get a strategy folks! Endless messages with I’ve 80% in ABC token, it will moon. I say, this is reckless.

Back to topic..

In my opinion that backtest was confirmed.

Who cares where the exact bottom is? I don’t know, no one does. It is a horrible mindset to have. Regardless of the answer, consider this:

If you were long at those breakouts you will look like a super hero 1 year from now. Don’t allow emotion to make your decisions.

Ww

I am a huge proponent of Bitcoin, and blockchain technology in general.  I study it on a nearly daily basis and use many metrics to measure its price action.  I just wanted to note to that based on my research Bitcoin is highly likely to drop significantly one more time before reaching its cycle bottom.  

Here are some conclusions I've reached based on my research:
-The drop will likely occur in October or November but could occur as late as the end of 2022
-The drop will be characterized as a rapid retracement in price (will be perceived as a crash) to a lower Fibonacci level (levels based on halving cycle trough and peak)
-The price can easily reach 10k or a bit lower (Order clusters are currently suggesting the price floor will be above 8k)
-Even after this drop, the price increases may be stunted more than usual into 2023 if monetary tightening or a subsequent recession ensues, though any drops in 2023 should not take out the 2022 lows on a monthly closing basis (meaning that no month in 2023 should close lower than the lowest price achieved in 2022 - though if this occurs it will likely be more due to a deteriorated global economic situation than any decrease in Bitcoin's inherent value).

One of the best websites for Bitcoin metrics is here: https://buybitcoinworldwide.com/stats/

I could be wrong, as anything can happen, but I am quite confident that another significant drop will occur before the next halving peak. Since that post, I've discovered that the best way to find a Bitcoin bottom is to use Fibonacci levels on a log-adjusted chart using halving cycle troughs and peaks.  So this is why my Fibonacci levels are different. I very strongly believe that Bitcoin will fall to $10k or below.  However, nothing is ever for certain, and I can be wrong.  One thing that seems fairly certain is that buying and holding Bitcoin (accumulating it) over the long term and never selling it is likely to be a successful strategy.  One just has to have the fortitude to not sell even during periods of extreme fear (e.g. US government bans crypto, Tether peg breaks, a major war starts, etc.)

Did they mean halving cycle? The only cycle that has empirically characterized Bitcoin's price action has been the halving cycle, which reflects increased scarcity and thus increased value. 

In terms of how high Bitcoin can peak in the next halving cycle, right now that maximum value is much less than 500k. In fact, even if we assume that ~18k was the cycle bottom, then the maximum peak for the next cycle is limited mathematically to 360k (yes, the maximum peak is calculable). Given the forecast that Bitcoin will drop another 50% before bottoming, and the fact that each successive peak is less impulsive, we're looking at the next peak breaching 100k but likely not reaching 200k. To be more precise, I am expecting that Bitcoin's price is extremely unlikely to surpass, or even reach, 160k at the peak of the next halving cycle (see below chart). Since I expect that Bitcoin's next halving cycle will coincide with either continued monetary tightening or a significant global recession, it remains quite likely that we’ll see a much less impulsive peak. 

This is not all bad news. Less impulsive peaks over time also mean that Bitcoin is becoming more stable over time. Increased stability / decreased volatility will set the stage for Bitcoin to become a more accepted financial asset. 

I will publish a post in the future on cryptocurrencies based on research and charts. Just know that Bitcoin, and decentralized blockchain technology, are unequivocally paving the path for the monetary system of the future.

You are my favourite.
There are coincidences with the post-halving peaks of April-November 2021 and 2013, is it possible that there will also be with the December-January bottom?
Also in 2018 the bottom was touched in December after the top of December 2017. It seems to repeat itself like a nursery rhyme in sequence:
Halving; top after a year and a half; bottom after 1 year; lower top after 6-7 months; pre-halving accumulation of about 1 year; halving; year and a half of parabolic rally.
It should be noted the gradual slowdown in percentage growth in cycles. To this we could add the theory of lengthening of the cycles.
It should also be taken into consideration that it is possible for Bitcoin's price to break the rules as it did in this case by falling and closing below MA200 and EMA200 on the weekly for the first time. title: BTC/USDT: 19400 penetrating opening the door to lower drop
name: JeanJean1983
contents:
BTC/USDT: 19400 penetrating opening the doors to lower consolidation

Context
- The Global Crypto market leads by BTC and ETH reversed a new bullish trend this summer - however the market is now challenging the capacity to go higher, 24900 never been reintegrated
- The global macro remains bearish (Crypto + Stocks market) leads by hawkish ton from central bank and a further inflation risk context
- BTC remains a long-term out-performer versus ETH

Previous Analysis 16/09/2022 :



Market configuration

- Graphical Elements :

Graphical Resistance = 23650 & 20700
Graphical Support = 16100 / 14600

- Mathematical Indicators:
EMA ( Exp Moving averages) are resistances below 23650 = Bearish
RSI indicator (below) is below 50% with no divergence = Bearish

- Elliot & Harmonic Wave (Fibonacci):
A last drop to draw the wave 5 C (4) has been completed - however a deeper elliott account can't be occur
Fibonacci resistance of the wave = 23650
Fibonacci support of the wave is 16100
Fibonacci upside target = 28800
Fibonacci downside target = 16100 / 14600 / 12400

Conclusion

Combining the fondamental situation (Global macro fighting against inflation with hawkish ton from FED) + Technical Elements , it now hard to find element to call for a further recovery, it is better to protect the gains from the summer and wait for clearer situation

Prefered case = As long as 23650 and 20700 are acting as resistance a further downside move is more likely with 16100 and 14600 as downside target.

Only 23650 in daily close reintegrated would invalidate the direct drop, opening at least a trading range opportunity with 28800 as upper part for now

title: XAUUSD - Awaiting for Lower Low Correction
name: Riliza
contents:
Gold is ready to do a correction of lower low structure. Last week it had tested at 1654 on its lowest point of the year. This week, there will be the FED interest rate decision which will likely push USD value to do higher high, this makes negative correlation to gold . While the USD is raising up, gold will be down accordingly.

Referring to Technical and statistics chart. You can see on my chart that all TF referring to Trend Diamond phase (Top right table) are all in down trend. MACD-V momentum is also recently in down-ward. We are waiting for US opening session to see the short term momentum of the market.

Currently the strategy of trend following will bring more favourable. However, you need to wait the correction and confirmation from the chart. Gold tried to reach 1680 this morning in Asia session but fail and drop to 1665. Take a look on Daily ATR level it has been test at ATR -50% already and next support zone will be ATR 75% of Sep 19 (1658)

Be careful if you open sell position. Try to place the position when the chart is at highest limitation of the day. Similar to buy position, you need to confirm it before place the order and keep in mind that it is the trend contrarian. The economics news this week may bring high volatility to gold . (Last week it was ranging about 80$ while the weekly ATR is about 55$)

My sell position is from 1680 which is the level of Support flipped to Resistant zone. My TP is 1654 which is its last lowest point of the year. My Expectation is gold will make Lower low and can be end up of this week on Friday below 1650.

See the statistics of monthly chart (bottom right table). In average it moved around 112$ , while in September is has moved only now (High - Low) around 80$ which means there is a possibility to go from 1735 - 112 = 1623$ by end of the month.

Just sharing the point of view, not trading advisory.

title: SP500- Doomed for a 500 points drop
name: Mihai_Iacob
contents:
In my yesterday analysis, I said that SP500 is facing a very strong sell zone above 4.1k and a drop is possible from now on.
CPI data triggered this drop and the index fell hard putting in an immense bearish engulfing on our daily chart .
I expect a resumption of the trend that started at the beginning of the year and is very possible for SP to visit the pre-pandemic high at 3.4k zone.
At this moment the price is 3950, just above confluence support given by the horizontal trend line and the rising trend line started in June and a corrective rally can follow.
This rally should be considered a good selling opportunity by traders and ONLY a break back above 4.2k would change this strongly bearish outlook


Best of luck!

Mihai Iacob

". There is a possibility of temporary retracement to the suggested support line (4.810).
. if so, traders can set orders based on Price Action and expect to reach short-term targets."

Technical analysis:
. WAVESUSD is in a range bound, and the beginning of an uptrend is expected.
. The price is above the 21-Day WEMA, which acts as a dynamic support.
. The RSI is at 65

Take Profits:

title: Long EGLD
name: evasivesteering
contents:
EGLD is among the top 50 biggest cryptos, using "Sharding" protocol for rapide validation of transaction at a lower cost.

Yesterday, it broke its trendline, starting from mid May, with good confluence of volume indicators.

  • Breaking volume is two time bigger than the average.
  • OBV broke its trendline and reverses.
  • MFI broke also its trendline and reverses.
  • CMF rose from negative to positive values and this indicates buy pressure is back.

A referenced TPs (blue lines) and SL (red one) are in chart.

Al the best!
Comment: EGLD still hold the current level although CPI news. It is consolidating in a diamond pattern and a break-out seems to happen soon. I expect a continuation upward.

Comment: Prices didn't close inside the diamond (so diamond pattern is invalidated).
The good news is that EGLD closed above the EMA 50D (current support) and hold.

title: SPX500 is trying to find a bottom
name: Trinnisia_Trades
contents:
In my opinion the market is trying to find a bottom. How far it will go down, Im not sure, but anything lower that 3450-ish, will take market to very oversold territory.
Everyone is waiting for Thursday’s CPI , depending on the result this can go either way:
1. Inflation is rising - this means FED will be rise rates by 0.75 in November, strong move downside, but then it to go to oversold territory and we might stay there few days before slow recovery starts. I dont believe the earning season takes market above 4000. More realisticaly 3900-3950.
2. Inflation is going down- rising rates start to do the job, FED might slow down next month but we’re not out of the woods yet. Economies already slowed down, we might see recovery on the markets and USD to cool off a little.
The only difference between 1 and 2 is when we start the recovery- this or next week.
If you look at the VIX , it is pretty high, over 30. On a brick of being overbought.
That makes me believe we can see some green candles in the next few weeks but after that I expect very red November.
I can be wrong, the markets are unpredictable so dont treat it as trading advice. Im not a professional trader but I’ve been following indices closely in the last few months. Always do your own analisys

title: USDCHF Potential for Bullish Continuation | 11 October 2022
name: FXCM
contents:

Looking for a break out buy entry at 0.9972 where the swing high,127.2% extension sits. The stop loss will be set at 0.9868, which is the previous low and the overlap support sits. Take profit will be at 1.0046, where the swing high is situated.

title: #Chainlink in a Bear Flag, LINK Dumps 5% from $8.2
name: Bitcoin_Analyzer
contents:
Past Performance of Chainlink
Chainlink is up roughly 35 percent from 2022 highs, but the token is within a rising wedge , a bear flag , and down five percent on the last trading day. From the performance in the daily chart , LINK bears are in charge. This preview would, however, shift if LINK breaks above $8.2 with expanding trading volumes pointing to changing sentiment.

#Chainlink Technical Analysis
The primary trend, from a top-down analysis, is southwards. From this angle, the main resistance line is at $9.5, marking August 2022 highs. LINK prices are currently under pressure, dropping five percent on the last trading day. Still, LINK is within the ascending wedge , and there are increasing risks of further liquidations. Losses below $6.6 would favor sellers, and LINK could sink to $6.1, below the support trend line in a bear breakout formation. If Chainlink is to bottom-up and bulls unshackle themselves from sellers, there must be a decisive break, first above $8.2 and later $9.5. In both instances, participation should be high.

What to Expect from #LINK?
Traders are cautious despite LINK outperforming Bitcoin in the past few trading weeks. Overall, LINK is in a bear flag with clear caps at $8.2 and $6.6 on the lower end. As the token yields to bears, traders can wait for clean breakouts in a welcomed shift of trend (though odds are low) or bear trend continuation towards critical support levels of Q3 2022.
Resistance level to watch out for: $8.2
Support level to watch out for: $6.6
